Name: Fibroadenoma
Condition description: Fibroadenomas are the most common cause of a benign solid mass in the breast.

Unrelated: Skin, Vascular, Large rod-like, Round, Rim, Dystrophic, Milk of calcium, Suture
Amorphous, Coarse heterogeneous, Fine pleomorphic, Fine linear or fine-linear branching
Asymmetry, Global asymmetry, Focal asymmetry, Developing asymmetry
Lymph nodes – intramammary, Lymph nodes – axillary
Lymph nodes – intramammary, Lymph nodes – axillary

Negative: Not circumscribed, Irregular (Not circumscribed), Spiculated (Not circumscribed)

Typical: Initial phase: Slow, Delayed phase: Persistent

Name: Papilloma
Condition description: Papillomas are benign neoplasms, arising in a duct, either centrally or peripherally within the breast. Many papillomas secrete watery material, leading to a nipple discharge. As they are often friable and bleed easily, the discharge may be bloodstained.
Differential diagnosis: ductal carcinoma in situ (DCIS)invasive ductal carcinoma with an in situ componentpapillary carcinoma of the breast can mimic an intraductal papilloma (particularly on ultrasound)

Possible: Calcifications in a mass, Intraductal calcifications

Name: Condition 1
Condition description: OK

Name: Invasive ductal carcinoma (IDC)
Condition description: breast cancer

Name: Mastitis
Condition description: breast inflammation

Name: lymphoma
Condition description: None
Differential diagnosis: primary breast lymphoma, extramammary lymphoma metastasis

Name: FIBROADENOMA
Condition description: Fibroadenoma is a benign fi broepithelial tumor withmixed stromal and epithelial elements

Name: LIPOMA
Condition description: A lipoma is a benign fatty mass

Name: INVASIVE LOBULAR CARCINOMA (ILC)
Condition description: ILC arises from the lobular epithelium
Unique findings: pet: high rate of false-negative findings, mammo: shrinking breast

Name: Sebaceous cysts
Condition description: Sebaceous cysts are retention cysts and are believed to arise from the acral surface of the skin by implantation of the epidermis into the dermis.

Name: Galactocele
Condition description: A galactocele is a benign milk-filled cyst
Unique findings: mammo: A circumscribed mass with a fat-fluid level on a mediolateral or lateromedial projection is diagnostic

Name: Duct ectasia
Condition description: Duct ectasia is a nonspecific dilation of the major subareolar ducts, with occasional involvement of smaller ducts
Unique findings: us: dilated ducts that may be filled with anechoic fluid, echogenic debris, or both
Associated conditions: plasma cell mastitis, obliterate mastitis, comedomastitis

Name: Epidermal inclusion cyst
Condition description: Epidermal inclusion cysts usually arise from obstruction of the infundibular portion of the hair follicle

Name: Fibrocystic breast changes
Condition description: Fibrocystic change is not a disease but refers to a constellation of benign histologic findings. It was previously referred to as fibrocystic disease, a name that should no longer be used because the symptoms are withinthe normal spectrum of hormone-related changes in the breast

Ignore: Skin, Vascular, Coarse or “popcorn-like”, Large rod-like

Name: fibroadenoma
Condition description: A fibroadenoma is a benign fibroepithelial proliferative tumor with the hallmark of a concurrent proliferation of glandular and stromal elements

Name: Intramammary lymph nodes
Condition description: An intramammary lymph node is a lymph node found within the breast parenchyma at any quadrant excluding axillary lymph nodes, The vast majority seen on mammography are in the upper outer quadrant of the breast

Name: Hamartoma
Condition description: Hamartomas are benign well circumscribed breast lesions composed of variable normal constituents of breast tissue including fat, glandular tissue, and fibrous connective tissue
Unique findings: mammo: thin radiopaque capsule, mri: thin radiopaque capsule, us: thin radiopaque capsule

Name: Lipoma
Condition description: Lipomas are benign fatty tumors that may occur anywhere within the breast
Unique findings: mammo: thin radiopaque capsule is classic.

Name: Fibromatosis
Condition description: Fibromatosis of the breast is a benign localized proliferation of fibroblasts that is nonmalignant but does have a tendency to recur after excision

Name: Fibrosis
Condition description: Fibrosis is a benign proliferation of fibrous connective tissue of the breast

Name: Adenosis
Condition description: Adenosis is a spectrum of histologic lesions ranging from hyperplasia of the lobule to sclerosing adenosis with fibrosis and calcifications

Name: Diabetic mastopathy
Condition description: Diabetic mastopathy is a condition in which stromal proliferation forms fibrous tumors predominately in patients with insulin-dependent diabetes mellitus

Name: Granular cell tumor
Condition description: Granular cell tumor is an uncommon usually benign tumor originating from Schwann cells

Possible: Homogeneous Medium, Rim enhancement Delayed phase Persistent

Name: Fat necrosis
Condition description: Fat necrosis involves necrosis of adipose tissue and is characterized by the formation of small quantities of calcium soaps when fat is hydrolyzed into glycerol and fatty acids
